Articles.Content:
I want

- To get a massive amount of refined kethane to Eeloo for a large refueling station.

- Get a station station on the pole of every planet and moon (other than gas giants).

Yup
World domination.

-Go to Jool and every other planet

-Get all the surface science on Jool

These are not really my goals, just my (ridiculously hard) criteria for winning KSP:

- Base and space station on/over every planet and moon (except for Jool)

- Being able to get to any location without quicksaving

- (Maybe) Capable of building an ship to travel interstellar distances

Yeah, most of these are just ridiculously hard, but if you could do them, you've won KSP

Keep in mind I still struggle to get to the Mun

I want to stop playing KSP at some point, "its done".

Not sure if its a realistic goal

These are not really my goals, just my (ridiculously hard) criteria for winning KSP:

If you want to try it though, the tutorial has reached Chapter 7 of 8 - Kerbin-system spacestations. The only chapter I still have to do is taking those stations everywhere else :-)

My long-term goal is to pull off a Whackjob-sized SSTO and deliver it to Eeloo or to Moho.

These are not really my goals, just my (ridiculously hard) criteria for winning KSP:

- Base and space station on/over every planet and moon (except for Jool)

- Being able to get to any location without quicksaving

- (Maybe) Capable of building an ship to travel interstellar distances

Yeah, most of these are just ridiculously hard, but if you could do them, you've won KSP

Keep in mind I still struggle to get to the Mun

You can't win KSP until you plant a flag on Kerbol and return safely
Does "scope complete" count for me?
I want to complete a successful Jool 5 mission. I'm partway through my third attempt.

These are not really my goals, just my (ridiculously hard) criteria for winning KSP:

What about completing the Jool-6 Challenge? No, I did not hit the wrong key.

What about completing the Jool-6 Challenge? No, I did not hit the wrong key.

So, you have to land on Jool itself, too?
I want every single point of science I can get from the stock Kerbin system. Then do it for every other PlanetFactory system. Every sweet, delicious point.

Gain some better professional certifications and move into a job with more chance of advancement.

Oh, you mean in KSP? Well, my "pipe dreams" that I've yet to actually attempt:

Jool-5, of course, but with some extra twist. Thinking of one with using purely ion engines (apart from the launches to LKO). I think it should be possible. NFP has engines capable of enough TWR to make a Tylo lander. Laythe might be the bigger challenge, since the NFP engines don't work in atmosphere, but I think the PB-ION should be able to propel a glider into orbit.

Land an E-class on Tylo.

Create a ship capable of "express" interplanetary trips. Duna in a week, Jool in a month, that kind of thing. Likely to need mods to do that, though I'm going to consider KSPI's warp drive "doesn't count".

So, you have to land on Jool itself, too?

That's exactly what I'm saying!

Play every version as thoroughly as I played 0.22, 0.23, and 0.23.5.

That should keep me busy for a while
A large Mun base, a quaint little base on Dun eventually, and an expedition to Laythe and Vall
Reach the Kerbal Space Center flagpole to finish my trip around Kerbin on a rover.
Finish my ISS and get started on a mun station with my shuttle (CSS mod)
Travelling to, exploring and colonizing the next star system. But I guess I will have to wait for the devs to make that possible.
To send kerbals to inhabit another planet and make it like normal life,here on kerbin.

To send kerbals to inhabit another planet and make it like normal life,here on kerbin.
make it like normal life,here on kerbin.
normal

When dealing with Kerbals, I don't think anything can be considered normal.

Visit all the planets. Yep. That's my long-term goal.

The reason it's been and continues to be such a hard road is my obsession with comfort for my Kerbals, reusable ships, and efficient use of time. I can't just asparagus 785 booster stages together and blast a dude to his death on Laythe six months later in a cramped space capsule.

I just did a single launch round trip to Moho's surface and back. That was fun.

But I still haven't planted a flag on Eve and and then returned to Kerbin. I suppose that's one of my long term goals.

I have a lot of current goals for the near and decently-far future.

-Finish Mun base and build transfer space station around the Mun.

-Build Minmus base and space station. Not sure if I really want to do this or not.

-Get some landers and probes to Duna, eventually Kerbals in the far future.

-Complete current work-in-progress space station around Kerbin.

Take Kerbals to and from Vall and Laythe.

Duna base?

I'm trying to do things in some kind of progression though, so not just doing those two objectives straight off the bat.
